description:
First off, japanese cuisine is an acquired taste, meaning not everyone will like it, and if they do, its very minimal or limited in taste. that said, here is my review.

This is my go - to japanese cuisine in downtown SF. The one on sutter is good too, but if you dont want to get venture out, this one will do the trick. I have been coming here for more than a decade and still love it, they have renovated it a few years ago and it looks much better now.

They have a frequent dining card, a $10.00 (max) worth of discount towards your final check, you have to accumulate a total of 10 points total to receive it, meaning if your final bill is $40.00, you will get a 4 points total added to your sanraku card until you reach 10 pts or a $10.00 gift cert/card will be sent to you and so on. The prices are reasonable for what you get, compared it to others in the same area.

The food here is always fresh, the staff are welcoming and are intune with customer's need and wants, and from time to time, will add new recipe on the menu. The former chef here, I think his name is shinji, competed once on that TV show iron chef america, and i think he won and now works for nobu in nyc. TIP -- be friends with the chef, they will make you a secret cuisine ( not on the menu) but just for you, enjoy !
author: YelpIsExtortion N S.

description:
Nothing about this place wowed me.  I arrived towards the end of the dinner shift and was seated at the sushi counter.  I had a OpenTable reservation for standard seating, but I didn't complain because the single tables were either not open or not cleared.

The staff, while friendly, really couldn't offer much opinion on the daily special menu (which was rather extensive).  I ordered the Sashimi Deluxe from regular menu and an Uni Shooter and Special Squid Sashimi from the daily menu.

The Uni Shooter was well balanced, but light on the uni.  I'm pretty sure they just gave me standard squid (and seemed to be confirmed once I got the bill).  The deluxe was nice and included rice and miso, however, 15 pieces would probably be more likely considered 12 in terms of size elsewhere.
author: Michael F.

description:
Let me start off my saying that I wanted to give my waitress an 100% tip because she was so good at her job and clearly cared about us having a great experience. 

On top of this, the food is amazing! We ordered the Tempura Udon, tekka roll, and Shrimp Tempura roll. The udon noodles and tuna tasted so fresh that it makes sense that this place costs more than other sushi places.

10/10 recommend!
author: Sydney G.

description: This Japanese restaurant is my favorite in SF. Trust me! I'm Japanese ;) Sanraku has two locations in SF, and food is much better than another one location. Since this place is located in the food court in Target, it doesn't have any fancy atmosphere. However, seafoods and sushi's are fresh and tasty, and other Japanese dishes are also fine. Staff members' hospitality is good too.
author: Yumiko H.

description:
Sanraku at the Metreon is located on the first floor Food Court area.  You can easily access it from Yerba Beuna Gardens as well as the entrance on 4th Street.

While the other restaurants there make you wait in line to order and then find a table to sit at, Sanraku has a waitstaff, takes reservations and does the seating for you.

Our food came out very quickly and we ordered a lot...   They have their service down to a science as most people are there to also see a movie after dinner and need to finish sooner than normal.  We sat down at 6:35pm and had our bill by 7:02pm.

The miso soup was my favorite out of everything that we ordered.  
I did love the texture and consistency to the California Rolls too but, I wished they were more flavorful.
The chicken teriyaki consisted of an all- white meat and good quality chicken pieces that were covered in quite the tasty sauce.
Their gyoza were smaller than what I'm used to and shaped like a traditional pot sticker.  The dipping sauce was good too.
I didn't care for the salad dressing as it was a bit too sweet for me.

Service was good.  It's a tight fit at most tables so prepared to get bumped.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Came here before going to a movie at 7:15 upstairs.  It is basically the only upscale restaurant on the ground floor.  I had been by the restaurant many times and eaten at the Sutter location and enjoyed it.

We arrived at 6 and ordered edamame, Crunch roll, Spider roll, Negihama, and another roll with Spicy tuna as well as various nigiri sushi.  The restaurant was packed full and by the time we left I heard the hostess tell people it would be a 20 minute wait.

The sushi was fresh, tasty, and well proportioned.  If anything we ordered too much for ourselves and left no room for popcorn (blechh sushi and popcorn).

Obviously a little more expensive, but this is a mall and this space felt like I was not in a mall. $75 later we were out of there in a little over an hour and saw a great movie.
author: Erik H.

description:
I would have given them a 2 Star, but hey, what do you expect from a mall foodcourt Sushi store, not a restaurant, store.  
Ordered 49er roll, Giant roll and a Spider roll, $48.05 w/o tip. 
The Sushi was platted well but the Sushi was very bland, but they have soy sauce and plenty of it, you'll need it.  I was very surprised on the lack of flavor, no spice or bite.  If you're going to the movies, you'll have room for popcorn and a soda.
author: David E.

description:
I like this place a lot. 
Sushi is always super fresh and tasty and the stuff is welcoming.
Its my go to place for non-fancy sushi.
variety is pretty good, both sushi as well as Saki. .
author: Eyal R.

description:
TIME: Friday @1pm

I came here with 10 other co workers with reservations for lunch. The staff was friendly and efficient. Some had to wait a lot longer than other for their food, but other than that this place is fine. I thought the it was pricey and taking into consideration of the location, I don't blame them. Although this place is tiny, you can make reservations for large parties like mine ahead of time :)

ATE:
UNAGI DON - $19
BBQ Eel with teriyaki sauce over rice.
This dish comes with 5 delicious slices of unagi with a generous amount of rice.  Actually if you're paying $19 dollars you BETTER get a lot of rice! :P This meal also comes with miso soup and some salad that I thought was fine.
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
I casually walked into this place twice. Once for lunch, the other for dinner. It's actually a gem in a shopping mall. Service is great. Food is at average Japanese restaurant level, not super exceptional but nothing to complain. Great stuff. 

I looked around, this is still my favorite choice for a light meal in the mall.
author: Shell J.

description:
Sanraku Metreon is located next to a food court, so, my expectations were held short. But the staff was so friendly and the food was so incredible that my memory of the experience may be indelible. 

The tuna avocado roll had perfect proportions; the spicy lovers roll consisted of beautiful contortions. 

I will happily come back here again, where I may eat comfortably and find my zen.
author: Mike A.

description: Had a great experience here yesterday! RB and I were looking for a sushi spot in the area, and came across this place. I wasn't expecting much once I realized that the restaurant is within the AMC Metreon shopping/movie complex, but I was pleasantly surprised! First off, the service was excellent. The host and our server were so nice, friendly, and attentive. The food was very, very good. We had the saba (mackerel) appetizer, some salmon ikura nigiri, a 49 roll, and a golden gate roll. Everything was fresh and delicious, and the prices were very reasonable. This dining experience was a good reminder to be open to trying new places and not judge a book by its cover. Will return!
author: Andrea M.

description:
Really good if you order the RIGHT things! I've tried a lot of stuff on their menu but my go-to's and favorites are:

-Popo Yaki: grilled whole squid! lots of flavor, really fresh, grilled to utter perfection!
-Eskimo Roll: salmon and avocado, super creamy and fresh! Loves of good fats ;)
-Spider Roll: the addition of shiso leaf in their spider roll is a gamechanger and is what differentiates their spider roll from the others out there! love!
-Tempura: their tempura is pretty good and they give a lot! i love ordering it as an appetizer or it comes with the tempura udon if you order that!

Their service is great! Super attentive and they're very willing to split things in two bowls if you let them know you're sharing. Great for lunch and dinner!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
I did not have a good experience with this place. 

The staff was nice and attentive (really the only reason I gave two stars instead of one), but the food was not up to par. 

I got the Volcano Roll & Spicy Tuna Roll.
Volcano Roll: Had no spice to it whatsoever, the tuna/ shrimp looked like a lump of a mushy something, did not look appetizing at all, was quite bland, and very oily
Spicy Tuna Roll: Not spicy AT ALL

The people I was with did not enjoy their food much either. Overall, the portions were small and overpriced. 
Will not be returning.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
Wow!! The sushi is so bomb here!! Every roll we ordered was better than the last. We tried the dynamite, sunset, volcano, and 49ers. They all were yummy! We also tried some nigiri which my husband enjoyed very much! 

They had plenty of seating and the customer service was good too. I asked for a Shirley temple but they did not have that. 

We ordered a lot of sushi but we still felt hungry which means their rolls are pretty small for the price you pay. The quality is great, though. 

I would recommend this place! Everything is delicious here.
author: Rubab M.

description:
Food: 4/5
Space: 4/5
Service: 4/5

Sanraku is always a solid option in SoMa for a nice meal. I agree with most of the reviews here in that the food is average/above-average but I like the consistency. I've never had a bad experience at Sanraku. I'm a fan of their Katsu Curry and other dons but haven't tried much of their nigiri. All the rolls I've ordered to-date have been solid though. This is a great spot for catching up with a friend or grabbing some take-out on a week day. Space is comfortable, though finding the entrance can be a little counterintuitive. Service is quick and friendly.
author: Derrick F.

description: You should really going to eat here if you are catching a movie at the meteron and are too lazy to go to a restraunt outside. The tempura good but the sushi was pretty mediocore. I could not taste whether the fish was fresh or not as there was so much sauce on top. In fact there was more sauce on a roll than actual fish. I could taste that the fish was almost fully cooked even though it says seared. I guess it would probably be a great place to bring someone who wants to try sushi but is too intimidated by the thought of eating raw fish.
author: Diane Z.

description:
I'm so conflicted as I write this review.

My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate a late valentines day before watching a movie. The sushi we ordered was perfect. The sashimi, even better. The mix tempura we ordered was the perfect amount of crisp and fresh all at the same time.

However the reason for four stars instead of five, would be there beef teriyaki plate. I know what you're thinking, who orders a generic meal of some type of meat teriyaki at a Japanese place. People with tons of allergies, like me! Lol.

While the presentation was amazing, the beef itself was extremely tough. Everything was in perfect portion but being as we saw the bus boy more than our waiter, my boyfriend and I just ended up asking for to-go containers for everything we weren't able to finish or really eat - to give to the homeless around downtown SF.
author: Shilo B.

description:
Came here on a Sunday evening during a work trip. The restaurant wasn't too busy at the time and my coworker and I sat at the bar. While the nigiri/sashimi we got was really good, the service was absolutely terrible. We first ordered a variety of sashimi and nigiri to start but the server never came back to us again. We wanted to order more food but it was nearly impossible to flag anyone down. It's like they don't even look up on purpose! They never came back to fill up our drinks or check up on us. Sitting at the bar, you would think the chefs would also check up on us or see if we wanted anything else....but not even a slight acknowledgement that we were there.

It's really too bad because the sushi was really fresh and kept us wanting more. The only time we got any attention was when they finally came to clear our plates and asked if we wanted our check, which was a fair amount of time after we had already finished. 

Check out this place at your own risk! Hopefully you won't get the terrible service like we did.
author: Annie L.

description:
This is my favorite sushi spot for lunch. My all time favorite thing to get here is the salmon belly sushi (seared salmon belly topped with a bit of lemon & salt). 

I also love the Golden Gate roll (seared salmon, scallion, tobiko, crab stick, avocado & miso sauce) and the Giants roll (seared spicy salmon, shrimp tempura, cucumber, tobiko, spicy mayo & eel sauce), and will typically get one or both of these rolls when I dine here.

Quality at this location has been consistently good, and I always look forward to my meals here.

It does get crowded during lunch hours or dinner over the weekends, so try to make a reservation if possible.
author: Grace C.

description: Went on a Wednesday evening with a reservation and once we had been there exactly 1 hour and had just finished our meal a waitress came to the table, blatantly asked us to leave, and told us another reservation had been waiting for 15 minutes and we were holding them up, as if we were being rude just for not being in and out of (not cheap) dinner in under an hour. I went with two friends and we were hoping to be able to catch up a little bit, but this was clearly not the place for that. This place is way overpriced for that kind of atmosphere, and the food is not good quality or quantity.
author: Maya D.

description:
Sanraku has been my go-to for my last couple of trips to San Francisco. Reasonable prices, convenient location, and sushi that does the trick. I've never actually dined in, just ordered takeout on Eat24, so my experience is based on the food.

The restaurant is attached to the Metreon building in Soma, right around a bunch of shops, restaurants, and a movie theater. I usually order a Philadelphia roll, a shrimp tempura, and spicy tuna roll, each for about $8/$9, which is affordable for San Francisco. Not the best sushi I've ever had, but after 6 hours of traveling from New York to San Francisco, it really does the trick. Especially on Sundays when NOTHING is open and I cannot bring myself to eat McDonalds. I've done this about 3 times, so it's good enough to keep me coming.

The 3 sushi rolls are usually ready for pickup in about 25-30 and the staff is always cordial. I'll probably be back because it's become a little staple for me when I visit SF, but would looooove if there was a sweet potato roll in the future, Sanraku!
author: Jordan B.

description:
In town for a work meeting. 

Wow. Just wow -  great time,  service and food.

Will be back when in the area again!!
author: Brian W.

description:
Never order the Togo service there! 
The food packed Togo is different than when u dine in.
E.g. all dinner will not come with miso soup if u ask for a Togo order
author: Leo S.

description: Aight sushi place in the middle of the mall. They get busy, so make reservations. My group luckily arrived before the onslaught of peeps arrived. Sushi was fine. I was quite a fan of the sesame chicken I ordered (save the steamed veggies, which were cold by the time my dish arrived).
author: Danny D.

description:
Amazing sushi, great quality, great staff and chefs 
My favorite sushi place in San Francisco so far.
Recommendation: try gyoza, spicy tuna roll, and shrimp tempura roll
author: Ruby B.

description:
I've been here twice now and it's been a high quality experience on both accounts. Service is really friendly and the sushi is delicious. We were just 2 people dining in for dinner on a Tuesday night, but there was still a bit of a line. Luckily we were seated after 10 minutes at the bar. 

FOOD: 
- negihama roll: melts in your mouth 
- rainbow roll: love the rainbow because you get different types of fish. All super tasty 
- golden gate roll: the salmon is to die for
author: Emma W.

description: Ate lunch here at 4th Street location by Moscone center. I ordered combo lunch with choice of column 1 Sashimi and choice from column 2 Tonkatsu. Both items very good and comes with soup and salad.
author: Clifford W.

description: The sushi was fresh & delicious. Although Americanized sushi includes more rice and is more filling, as someone whose visited Japan several time. The sushi, seasoning, & presentation are more traditional to Japan (where you'll never see "California Roll"). With less rice, you appreciate the combination of flavors all the more especially the fish. The hamachi toro was excellent - I typically order hamachi but the toro (fatty belly) was especially rich in flavor. A bit pricey compared to some places but you do get what you pay for. Just do not be disappointed if you feel less full - order a rice bowl if you are really hungry.
author: Jamez B.

description:
Since we think that the quality of the food at Sanraku in San Jose is consistently better than that of any other Japanese restaurant in the south Bay, we decided to walk over to the Sanraku Metreon in San Francisco, after spending a pleasant afternoon at the MOMA museum.  We were not disappointed in any way. 
We had edamame, agedashi tofu, asari miso soup, gyoza, gindara saikyo (fish), natto roll, and kappa maki. Everything tasted fresh and delicious. 
Although they do not seem to have Japanese servers (just as in San Jose), the sushi and other dishes live up to the standards that one would expect to find in Tokyo and have obviously been prepared by experienced Japanese chefs.
The service was very warm, in any case, and the prices very fair.  We will definitely be back.
author: R L.

description: Love this place. Super casual and convenient location. The rainbow roll is my very favorite.
author: Ana M.

description: A lot to be improved on.  The atmosphere was pretty boring, the sushi was so-so.  Fell apart lacked any depth of flavor.  The 49er roll was the best one but even that one was more avocado and rice than actual fish.  Pretty disappointing.
author: Matt B.

description: Way overpriced for okay sushi. They took way too long and then insisted that if we didn't want to wait too long, to pay before we even received our food. Wouldn't return.
author: Carmen C.

description:
Not great, but good. I ate there last night with a few friends before seeing a movie. The question is, what should my expectations be? This is a Japanese restaurant in the heart of the city and should it reflect that? Or, is it just a Japanese restaurant in the mall, even though it is in the city?

I'll admit it more of the former than the latter. If this restaurant weren't in the city, I would have given in 3.5 stars. But, it is in The Metreon and I thought it would be better.

The food: I had the kastu donburi and while it wad good, it's something that I could have made at home. I wanted it to be better than I what I could make. The quality was good and it tasted pretty authentic, so for $13 I can't really give it less than 3 stars.  But, it was about a half a step above mall food.

The service: Also good. Our server was took our orders promptly and brought the food out promptly. She checked up on us once (during the meal) and then brought us a check at the end, so all good. The place was packed and I didn't expect much more than that. One thing, I asked another server (ours was busy) make change for me and she took my money and never came back. She was busy too, so I'll give her that. After about ten minutes I had to flag her down and she pointed to front desk. The host at the desk gave me my change. So, I learned it would have better to ask our server to make change.

Analysis: I'd go back, but only if pressed for time and I was craving Japanese.
author: Rich H.

description:
3.5 stars, here are the pros and cons:

Pros
- Convenient location. Inside of the amc metreon building, easy for a quick meal before a movie, or get some Sharetea after the meal.
- Great atmosphere. Not super loud, nice interior decorations, and not too cramped.
- Nice selection of items on the menu. Personally I really enjoy their chawamushi (steamed egg)! 

Cons
- Portions are generally on the smaller side so it can be pricey for what you're paying for.
- Quality/taste wise it's rather average. 
- Service is on the slower end, so may not be the best "quick bite before the movies" option unless you're not in a rush.
author: Mandy H.

description:
Casual ambience, located in the back of the Metreon.  

It's must be Friday, Good quality fish, rice was small grain, medium texture hard and cool. I prefer warm and soft. Not a fan of their wasabi. Tomago is homemade, not impressed with texture and taste. 

Topping on sushi too overpowering...

Main Attraction

Maguro - nice and lean

Oh Toro from Spain, very fatty - nice 1 to 1 ratio

Uni - Santa Barbara is always good.

That's it from what I tried. 

Minus star for service having a low friendly vibe.
author: tommy c.

description: Not bad. The rolls are pretty small. Fish tasted fresh . Service was great but a little slow. Will be back if in the area, but was expecting more. Ordered Crunch, Dynamite and Philadelphia rolls.
author: Lidiyanna Z.

description:
I got food poising from you guys today. Had the sushi lunch combo. 6 nigiri 6 California roll and miso soup and just tap water. It must have been the nigiri. 

I ate at the bar. 

Too bad. The place looked 'clean enough' and busy. I hadn't gotten sick from sushi in a long time. 

You guys need to be careful with your food handling practices.
author: Miguel L.

description:
For fear of sounding like an entitled Millennial, coz work is waaaay too stressful with my 50+ emails and gosh, I don't even have time to keep up with social media, let alone, BREATHE ... hey boss, I'm taking a 2 hour lunch, just so you know.

"Me" time is fun.

ME. ME. ME.

Sit outside with a view of the Yerba Buena gardens especially on a nice sunny day and eavesdrop on those two hot Aussies sitting behind you. Order the wonderfully soft agedashi tofu in a dashi broth and get the huge sashimi salad decorated with fresh sashimi. Request a lemon water from your obliging server and sit back and relax because you sooo deserve this long lunch break.

You'll be tempted to order rice because hello, Japanese food. But DON'T DO IT. Carbs are evil!

Get a bottle of sake instead. It is ME time, after all ;-)
author: Janice C.

description:
Sushi here was satisfying. The food took quite a while to come and wasn't anything spectacular. Very average sushi. I personally don't see myself coming back any time soon since there are more restaurants I'd rather try. 

The sushis we had were rainbow, dragon, sunset, volcano. I'm not going to talk about each one because it tastes just like what is inside it. Typical sushi.
author: Sammy T.

description:
Conveniently located in the Metreon, Sanraku is a Japanese restaurant that serves sushi, sashimi, noodles, and sake. Although Stephanie S. and I haven't went out of our way to eat Japanese food since our Japan trip, I told her I was craving udon since it was raining when she visited San Francisco. David C. had recommended this place to me, so I wanted to see if it was as good as he said!

Service was a little spotty - got seated quickly, took forever to get our orders, food came out in a timely manner, water wasn't filled at all until the end of our meal, and the bill took forever. Definitely not the best service you'd expect at a Japanese restaurant.

Udon selections include: chicken, tempura, veggies, and beef. I ordered the chicken udon ($11), and it was pretty good! The udon was perfectly cooked, broth was flavorful, and portion was filling.

The tonkatsu curry was really meh. Breading was a mouthful and the meat was too dry. Good thing there was curry to dip the meat in! 

I'd definitely be back for the udon, though. Slurp, slurp, slurp!
author: Christine S.

description: Amazing place that I definitely recommend! Really good fish quality! Everything is fresh and tastes great. Really nice staff and great menu and chefs specials. As a sushi lover totally recommend you to go!
author: Yulia K.

description:
Their Chirashi bowl is outstanding!  One of the best selection of sashimi cuts, uni, ikura, tobiko over rice!   This sushi bar is tucked away below the cinema and adjacent to an upscale food court across the street from Westfield Mall.  Get there early or put your name on the wait list.  They have great specials and a chef's offering (Omakase) for $50.  Great assortment of high end, fatty sushi!
Be sure to try the kamigaki hamachi Kama, grilled yellow tail collar!  
Another great item:  yamakake maguro, grated Yama imo (white paste) with chunks of fresh ahi.  Be sure to mixed with an adequate amount of soy sauce and wasabi!
Their dinner menu selection is good, but not exceptional.
author: Richard H.

description:
Giving it 3.5 to 4 stars for its great service, friendly staff, and pretty decent quality sushi. 

Definitely a restaurant that caters to tourists. Portions are decent. Menu isn't phenomenal. But the chefs are all Japanese! And after speaking with one of the chefs at the bar, he confirmed they hire Japanese chefs namely! 

Fish quality was pretty good. One of the more standout pieces was the hotate (scallop sashimi). Less memorable was the Uni shooter- too much sesame oil masking the flavor and the texture of uni. 

Be advised- if you've got a friend New to sushi, this is not a bad place to try out. But if you're a sushi fanatic, order off of the specials and don't try anything too fancy. You'll be disappointed. Flavors really are catered to the masses.
author: Michelle C.

description: This sushi restaurant is the only restaurant in the Metreon mall which should've been a red flag from the beginning. Their sushi is average at best and extremely overpriced. When they brought out plates and bowls they were dirty BOTH TIMES. Would not recommend. Just go to ANY other food court restaurant in the mall and you'll be better off. Peace.
author: Julie Y.

description:
My go ûber dependable working day meal spot. 
Good nigiri at fair prices. 
Lunch bento specials. 
The also have a rewards program.
author: Geordie E.

description:
Dinner review. Sushi.

Toro belly - 3/5
Variety - 3/5
Quality - 2/5
Quantity - 4/5
Convenience - +1

Overall, subpar sushi but great location. "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description:
Decided to choose Sanraku to meet a friend for lunch, since they have healthy offerings and it is in a convenient location.  

Service was a little spotty as it took awhile for us to get our order taken, and my dining companion asked if she could just have the dipping soba without the tempura and they said they could do this, but then brought it out with tempura too.  Taste wise I think she thought her soba was fine.  We also shared an order of gyoza which was standard.  I got the sashimi salad (another friend raved about this to me).  They were very generous with the fish, and unfortunately wouldn't take any requests to omit certain fishes and give more of tuna or salmon as I asked.  The dressing was aight citrus dressing.  I loved the salmon and tuna but didn't care for the mackerel or hamachi.  I've only had hamachi at Alexander's before and loved those little shooters.  The fish seemed fresh, I have to warn you that I am just very picky with fish.  

I've heard that the original Sutter location is better so if you are a fish aficionado, you may want to head to that location instead.  All in all, Sanraku at Metereon is a decent option for Japanese lunch in downtown.
author: Cat C.

description: Saw folks talking about the crispy sesame chicken and had to try it alone with the tuna sashimi.  The chicken was delicious and the fish melted in my mouth.  Everyone there was really nice.  Recommended.
author: Al L.

description:
I came here at 11:30am on a Friday and was very happy to see that it was open. YELP says that it opens at 4pm on Fridays.  

The location is excellent. It is located in the Metreon center food court, across the street from Mascone West Convention Center. 

Overall, this a good little Japanese restaurant. They have a great selection of food items and drinks. 

I had the Sunset Roll, the Spicy Salmon Roll, and the Spicy Tuna Roll.  The rolls were delicious, and the fish was good quality. The only change I would make would be the amount of cucumber they stuff in. I had to take some out. 

The service was a little slow, but very friendly. 

I would come back the next time I come to San Francisco.
author: Alexia D.

description:
Really good sushi and service.
Nice selection of well prepared sushi as well as other dishes and any place that has chawanmushi is going a little bit farther than most restaurants.
author: Beerboy M.

description: Compared to the original one on sutter street, this place food is ok. Salmon terriyaki is taste like other japanese restaurants. I went back to the one on Sutter Street for this salmon: crispy skin w/ perfect cook fresh fish. What a bummer: same restaurant but w/ different quality of the same kinda food. Tonkasu is really dried.
author: Sanguan L.

description: We called ahead and made reservations and still had tok wait . The it took 35 min to get our sushi order . The sushi portions where small and tasted... ok .
author: Sara M.

description: Good Japanese restaurant with a wide selection on menu. Their beverage selection is typical of a Japanese restaurant  .
author: Aly A.

description: Excellent sweet shrimp, melt in your mouth salmon, succulent fatty tuna. Great service too! Ordered from the chef's menu for the freshest sushi I've had in forever.
author: Marci B.

description: This is my go to for quick sushi lunch. They have great deals for lunch and the service is great. For some reason I feel like this place has better quality fish than most sushi spots I've tried in SF. Definitely super yummy!
author: Nicole N.

description:
Considering this place is inside a mall, I think it's decent, definitely not the best of the Japanese restaurants, but very convenient. 

I ordered curry don with katsu (extra $4 charge). The curry is not very spicy, and I wasn't aware there would be meat inside the curry; it was a little dry, in my opinion, not tender. The katsu was well done, soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. 

The order came with a side of salad and miso soup. The soup's flavor is good, but could go for some more seasoning. The salad was drenched in dressing, it became a little sour and salty, not very pleasant; if the salad was lightly dressed it would have been delicious.
author: Catarina Z.

description: I can have Japanese everyday and Sanraku at Metreon is very special out of all the Japanese restaurants in town. Sushi chefs are all Japanese and they import their fish straight from Tokyo fish market. Price is very reasonable for quality food, the atmosphere is casual that you feel relaxed and located just next to Yerba Buena park and AMC cinema. You will hear servers speaking in Japanese and the menu has variety of quality sakes to choose from. Simply put, this is the best destination for real sushi lovers in SF!
author: Cyndi B.

description: In a city of phenomenal Asian restaurants, this one holds its own as a solid choice, especially if you're nearby and looking for something convenient. I was staying at the Marriott Marquis and didn't want to schlep too far on this particular night. I ended up having the tempura udon, which was totally satisfying--nicely crafted soup, very well done tempura. My friend's salmon teriyaki was tasty if a bit on the oily side. I can't speak to the sushi, which is apparently this restaurant's strongest suit, but my entree filled the bill just fine. Exceptionally friendly wait staff, too!
author: Bob H.

description:
Also great place for sushi. Friendly service. Authentic Japanese kitchen. Haven't tried anything else then Sushi but I am sure that all that gets out of the kitchen is delicious. 

They're used to people going to need to order/eat faster than usual as the cinema is next door so perfect place to eat prior to movie night
author: Pieter D.

description:
Convenience is the word that first comes to mind when I think of Sanraku. It's right smack in the center on the first floor of the Metreon. It was movie night for my wife and I and since Jurassic World started at 7pm, we made reservations for 5:30pm on a Saturday.

So upon arrival the restaurant was semi-empty. Not really busy but 5:30 is an early dinner time. We were handed menus and asked what drinks we would like. It's all the typical Japanese/sushi type items you'd expect. They actually have a nigiri list of fish imported from Japan, New Zealand, and Europe as well. However we stuck to the regular menu:

Sushi Platter: this consists of California roll and 8 pieces of nigiri (chefs choice)

Dragon and rainbow rolls.

I thought the sushi was average. The cuts of fish are on the small side, not generous by any means. The quality was fine. Presentation-wise it was decent. Nothing really stood out, but at the same time I didn't have anything glaringly bad from what I ordered.

The service was ok, however I did have to look for the waitress a couple times during the meal. But everyone there was extremely friendly. Price-wise it's on the higher side, especially considering the portion sizes but I understand that rent is probably high inside the Metreon. 

So how would I rate Sanraku overall? I'd say "convenient".
author: Michael L.

description: It was okay. Nothing special in terms of sushi and the location was off of a food court. For the price it was about average. I think the atmosphere played the biggest part in the low score.
author: Angela K.

description: Pretty good food and friendly service.  The chef worked with my shellfish allergy and made the experience better.
author: Victor A.

description:
It's kind of overpriced for the size and quality. Uni and toro would literally be twice as much as any other nice restaurant in the area. Quality is ok, fresh but not the freshest I had. 
Sizes are twice smaller than other places. 
Service: not bad not good. Ok. I wasn't expecting much from the food court spot. But prices are definitely higher than regular food court place. 
Mehhh won't come back 
Ps. Dessert sundae thing was not bad, will probably try to make it at home
author: Asiyat T.

description: Just tried this place and it was pretty good. Ordered their edamame, gyoza and golden gate roll. The roll was put together perfectly and our server told us we just beat the rush. Our food was made and delivered almost immediately which was perfect since we were hungry.
author: Yanna V.

description: It's better than my expectation as it only has 3.5 star rate here. Chefs are Japanese. They warmly welcome me when I sit down at the bar. The lunch set are quite reasonable price: a plate of sashimi (5 ticket pieces) + a plate of teriyaki +salad+soup+rice at 20$!
author: Karen Z.

description:
Good spot for Japanese food in the Metreon food court. Not the best, but it'll do if you're having cravings for udon or good raw fish at an affordable price. I typically avoid going to Japanese restaurants in the city because I would rather go all out and do omakase when I have the chance.

It's nice to know this restaurant has its own seating for customers than it being part of the communal area. One of my girlfriends and I came here after work for dinner and got seated immediately even when there was a good amount of people here already. We got two rolls (tuna & avocado and the rainbow roll) to share and I got the tofu soba while she got the curry udon (which has meat in it! She's vegetarian and the menu did not specify that there was meat in the dish which caught us both a little off guard since they have an option for chicken udon/soba so just an FYI). Our bill came out to be $48; so $24 each for a solid meal! Not bad and just what I expected to spend. I felt feeling very full and satisfied afterwards. Good portion sizes here!

I definitely want to try their sashimi salad next time, as I heard it was worth getting and sharing between two people. Will come back for their noodle dishes as I really enjoyed my soba & my friend loved her curry udon.
author: Kathleen S.

description: No matter how many times my Japanese husband and I eat here, the food is always amazing and the quality is consistently perfect. The foods here remind my husband of home.
author: T.J. L.

description: This sushi place is located inside the Metreon so seating is pretty limited. We didn't have to wait to be seated though and got our order fairly quickly. We got the dragon roll and the rainbow roll. The fish is fresh and I liked the presentation. It's a little pricy since it came out to nearly $60 for two people, and all we ordered was three rolls. There are definitely better sushi joints in sf but this is conveniently located since it's near the movie theater and Moma
author: Trisha S.

description:
I'm embarrassed to admit that I've been ignoring this place for years. The one on Sutter has been there a number of years, but I've never tried that location either even though the reviews are better. I just figured how good could it be if they decided to open one at the Metreon with a front entrance smack in the middle of the food court (photo: http://bit.ly/1a9STyS). Surely it can't be any better than Sorabol Korean or Coriander Thai. Well, I was wrong. I admit it. I'm not sure why Jamie W. and I ended up here for dinner on a Sunday, but I had it my head that I should try it at least once. We were taken into the inner recesses of the restaurant in the far right corner, but it didn't appear to affect the speed of their service.

The menu is quite comprehensive spanning all the expected Japanese dishes including quite a sushi selection. We started with our usual, a $4 bowl of Edamame lightly seasoned with sea salt (photo: http://bit.ly/1xrJEEd). Good start. Jamie ordered the $16 Sesame Chicken, quite a pile of chicken breast pieces marinated with a sweet sauce so that the sesame seeds had something to hold onto. It came with steamed vegetables and a tiny scoop of potato salad (photo: http://bit.ly/19mIpuJ). The poultry was surprisingly moist with the seeds providing a nice crunch. Because he ordered a full dinner, he also got the bowl of salad with miso dressing (photo: http://bit.ly/1CBEvtB) and the cup of miso soup (photo: http://bit.ly/19mIz5k), both done primarily by the numbers but both satisfying nonetheless.

I decided to try the $15 Sashimi Salad, which was quite an extravaganza of fresh sashimi - in particular, tuna, yellowtail, shrimp and squid - with organic mixed greens and sliced cherry tomatoes and topped with salmon roe (photo: http://bit.ly/1xOamaq). It was genuinely delicious, a most fortunate and refreshing surprise that was certainly hearty enough as an entree. As a chaser, I ordered the $8 Chawanmushi just because I hadn't had any in a long time. It's a savory steamed egg custard filled with seafood, spinach and mushrooms (photo: http://bit.ly/19mIgre). It was one of the best ones I've had in a long time as it managed the precarious balance between pudding-like and firm. Even though Sanraku was borne out of the Marriott Corporation and not a Ginza-originated chain, I still say give this Sanraku a try.

FOOD - 4 stars...unexpectedly solid Japanese fare here with an exceptional sashimi salad
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...outside it's the Metreon, inside you might as well be in the basement of the Matsuya Ginza department store
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...quick and responsive
TOTAL - 4 stars...don't judge a Metreon operation by its cover... or its neighbors
author: Ed U.

description:
After visiting the Sanraku branch in Union Square, I found out that they had a branch conveniently located right at the Metreon. Came here three times, once by myself, and the other two times with friends.

I've tried a few of their rolls, but none of them really stood out to me. The sashimi salad, the item which I order frequently at the Union Square branch, was delicious - very generous portions of fish fixed with greens and topped with a tasty sauce.

What stood out the most here was the toro skewers, two pieces of cooked fatty tuna belly that just melts in your mouth. Definitely recommend giving that a try!
author: Alvin W.

description: Best bento box I have had. The teriyaki salmon was so flavorful and tasty. The California sushi comes with abundant crab meat, and the gyoza was crispy while not heavy. They were displayed in such a beautifully, which indicates the attitude of the restaurant.
author: Yunzhu C.

description: Based upon current visit.  Disappointed that spider roll came out cold and soggy.  Disappointed that staff knowing that kitchen was backed up did not offer soup or edamame as a way to say we are sorry.  Disappointed that water glasses weren't refilled.
author: Robert H.

description:
What is it about sushi places in San Fran? I have had just the most frustrating experiences here. Never been a problem anywhere else.
The first time and only time I will eat at this place. I arrived, put my name on the wait list. At least four parties were seated before me though I arrived first. Was told they had reservations. I didn't pay attention whether they also put their name on the waiting list, so gave the hostess the benefit of the doubt. Then a guy who put his name on the list after me got seated, not 2 minutes after I complained about the wait. Hostess overlooked my name on the list. Finally got seated when I told her I was leaving unless I was getting seated immediately. Then she seated me at a table that had been free virtually the entire time, almost one hour, that I was there waiting. Ordered the food, the wait for my sushi took about half an hour to arrive. It was OK, not great, not terrible, but rather pricey for the quality. Entire dinner took two hours and not because it was so good that I couldn't bring myself to leave. It should've been an in and out affair lasting no more than an hour.
author: T F.

description: Their avocado roll is the best I have ever had. Great vegetarian options! They also have a location at the airport which is ok, but their restaurant is far better.
author: Rishabh J.

description: Pretty good sushi . I was in the area for a conference, a couple of coworkers invited me for a dinner to this restaurant. Not the best sushi of my life, but pretty good.
author: Lisa P.

description:
The service was not helpful for my food sensitivities. When asked about what was in the salad dressing, the waitress had no idea. When I was ordering the Yakizakana with the salmon, the waitress was getting very frustrated with my request of the fish to have salt and pepper, but she did accommodate me and put the sauce on the side. 

As for the meal, the chefs left huge fish bones in the salmon which is very dangerous. I could have choked on one of them! They also really over-salted the salmon, it was as if they left a beach of salt on top of the salmon. 

 I really feel they should be more accommodating to those who have food sensitivities and not treat us with such disrespect.
author: Alana C.

description: Much better IMO than their other location. Sesame chicken is delicious and while their dinners are not cheap, they are very generous with portions and include a lot of steamed veggies. Better quality rice than many Japanese restaurants. Good sushi too.
author: Inago R.

description: The sushi is far from idea. The rice taste bad. I have fried chicken and it was okay. I don't recommend this place.
author: Shikai L.

description:
I enjoy coming to Sanraku for a variety of reasons.  It's close to the office, I can sit indoor or outdoors (weather permitting) and they have a nice variety of selections.  Their bento box is always changing, which I enjoy since it's one of my "go-to" picks.  However, the combination boxes and sushi are also very good. 

I've always received good service and it can get busy during the lunch-hour.  I like that I can sit and relax for lunch, near my office and enjoy a good meal.  

It's located inside the Metreon, which has a variety of food selections.  Prices are reasonable, considering they're located in SOMA.
author: Lon H.

description: Conveniently located inside the Metreon! Sushi here was okay, I tried the 49ers roll and rock n roll roll. My friend and I were happy with it. Good but not the best, at decent prices. I'd come back because there aren't many sushi places like this in the area.
author: Corinna T.

description:
I went there recently when a friend suggested it.  Wow!  I can't believe I missed this place.ng wa

Everything was fresh, servings were huge and service was professional.

I plan to go back the next time I'm in the area.
author: Lois L.

description: A great sushi place in the AMC theater mall right next to target. It's run by Japanese and they get fresh fish every Friday from Japan. They have a sister store on such her that gets better reviews, this one gets super busy probably because of the movie theater. But inside especially at the bar you will get great sushi, we usually eat nigiri so if that is your faire this will make you happy. A bit pricey but we ate a great sushi meal in about 30 minutes and made it in time for the movie.
author: David A.

description:
I love Sanraku, but mostly I love Sanraku because I am a huge salmon addict. Their salmon bowl puts me in such a happy place. I always request teriyaki sauce on the side, and there's never been an additional charge. The trick here is that the salmon teriyaki doesn't come with cucumbers, and I like to pretend to be healthy. So I get the salmon bowl with the cucumbers and hoard some teriyaki sauce on the side.

They also always have a daily bento special which is great value for the price you pay. They give you a ton of food. So check that out as well!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
I loved the Sanraku on Sutter when I went there for dinner so I was excited to treat my friends here on a Friday afternoon.

The food here can be a bit pricy, but being that it is located within the Metreon Center with its own space for seating, one can't really expect it to have cheaply priced meals. When I came here, there was immediate seating for 4 which was nice and the service was always very friendly. We ordered some rolls to share, and they were each pretty good in their own way, but nothing extraordinarily special.

Sanraku in Metreon is a pretty good place for a nice sit down meal with Japanese food, though I find the one on Sutter to be a slight notch above this one.
author: Joshua M.

description: This is my favorite Japanese restaurant! I live in Sunnyvale and I drive 45 min to the city every week just for this place. Nothing beats it from the prompt and quality service and food to the incredible setting and ambience. AJ is amazing, he knows what I want before I can even ask. Everytime I come they make it an excellent dining experience.
author: Judy R.

description:
Went here for lunch when we were in San Francisco for a conference. The place was very crowded for lunch, so we had to wait a while for a table. Our table for three was smooshed into a little area near the kitchen and bus station, so the hubs had to deal with a lot of server traffic behind him and was bumped a few times. The service was good, but a bit slow (again, they were really busy). Our sushi was fresh, but not exceptional. I was a bit disappointed because I have had great sushi in San Francisco and was expecting the same here after the reviews and especially with the high menu prices.

Overall, it was a safe place to get average sushi, but don't expect to get your socks blown off.
author: Lisa S.

description:
This review is based on the soba, sashimi, and tempura basket. I haven't tried the myriad of sushi dishes so I don't know how they taste like, but from what I've tried on the menu, they were all quite tasty. The presentation of the dishes was very visually appealing, and they don't skimp on the food either.

The meal comes with miso soup and salad on the side (extra food, always a plus). The tempura was well-fried and very crispy. The soba's texture was very chewy and cold, just the way it should be. The sashimi was fresh and came apart easily when I bit into it. 

This place is located within the Yerba Buena center and is the only food court restaurant where you cannot take the food elsewhere to eat, which might be a negative for some people. Overall, you should definitely try this place if you're craving decent Japanese food. Don't let the exterior and barrier from the rest of the food court deter you.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Wow! An actual restaurant in Metreon. I never notice this restaraunt until I walk in. I will say this restaurant is AMAZING! Now I need is a girlfriend.

The price is OK. It is San Francisco so I can not complain. 

I had the San Francisco and Rainbow (no jokes please). My sushi was GREAT!

Will I come here again? YES!
author: Ronald N.

description: Waited over 30 minutes for a simple sushi box lunch. Coworkers lunches all came and went before I got mine. Eventually had to just ask them to box it up since it didn't seem like I would have time to eat it there. Didn't want to have everyone else sit there and watch me eat.
author: Matt S.

description: Tried this place for lunch and oh how delighted we were!! Tried their house hot sake and it was delicious - ordered bunch of rolls and polished them off in no time. Nice small place to try if you are in the area. We will be back for more.
author: Janhavi A.

description:
I saw the great reviews and had to give it a chance.  It was rush hour during lunch at the RSA Conference.  We had to wait about 10 - 15 minutes before being seated.  We ordered the miso soup, Dynamite roll, Rainbow roll, Volcano roll and CT roll.  Everything tasted pretty good but they never checked up on us.  

I would come back again, but I will come much earlier.
author: Reggy H.

description: Not sure the reasons for the high reviews. I wouldn't really call this a restaurant as it's pretty much located in a food court. We weren't familiar with the area as it was our first time to SF. We relied on yelp to find us a good sushi place. The pictures on this page were quite misleading as we thought we were walking into a trendy japanese SF restaurant. Instead, it was connected to an AMC food court. I know it's a bit unfair to review without trying the food, but when we sat down at the sushi bar area, we were afraid to eat the sushi as the fish did not look fresh and was covered in plastic wrap with very limited selection. The menu was made of paper, had grease stains on it, and the "restaurant" didn't look clean. My intuition told me to skip this place and move on.  If you are looking for an actual sushi restaurant this is not it. If you're looking for Food court sushi, then perhaps this is for you.
author: Anh N.

description: I am not sure why this restaurant got only 3.5 stars. Perhaps this is because it is located in a mall. This is one of the better affordable sushi spots in town. The fish is always fresh and the service is always friendly.
author: Mali E.

description:
We headed here for lunch after encountering a massive queue elsewhere. The location of this place is a bit meh - it's attached to a shopping centre but it has a separate restaurant space so once you're inside, it's fine. We had a short wait for a table while they arranged us a table of 6 and then we were ready to order. 

They have a bento of the day which is on display at the counter - I always love a bento so decided to go for that. We also got some dumplings and sushi for the table - the dumplings here are excellent, I'd definitely recommend those. The bento box ordered arrived a bit after everyone else's food and they were packed with a selection of dishes as well as as separate portion of rice. Nothing in the box blew my mind - it was all nice and tasty and fresh. There was a weird fried shumai which I didn't really like the texture of but apart from that I was pretty impressed with this place.
author: Briony C.

description:
I'm not sure why Sanraku gets a bad rap-- or is "average." It's pretty good, has Japanese people that SPEAK Japanese running the kitchen/restaurant and has an abundance of specials at any given time. I'm sold. My only qualm with Sanraku is the pricing. The sushi is a bit pricy given the location and the portions. 

But DAMN, if it isn't delicious.
I haven't tried everything on the menu, but anytime they mention 'specials,' I'll probably get it. They have monkfish liver here, which is something that seems offputting but GOD, it's so good. I haven't tried the uni here, but I've tried a lot of their other specials and each one of them has tasted fresh and delicious. Like I said, I'm not too sure why Sanraku has average reviews when their specials are pretty good and not ordinary. You wouldn't be able to get monkfish liver at just any ol' sushi joint. They take pride in their sushi and it shows. If you're going to follow the standard menu, you may be disappointed. The menu is average, and not the best Japanese food I've had, but it's doable in a pinch. I can see why people are not happy with the regular menu, but those people should just be adventurous and try everything on the specials menu :)

This would be a great place to have a quick date night before watching a movie at the Metreon. The service is also on-point, but it does get pricey-- so watch out!
author: Christa Lei S.

description: Everything is good. Nothing is spectacular. There's definitely an authentic feel, but nothing stands out like something I must go back for. I've done the sushi set numerous times, the combinations a number of times ie salmon terriyaki and some cali rolls or nigiri or something else. Consistently good, but not something that I would say this is awesome, I must go back.
author: Alton Y.

description:
I've had mixed experiences with Sanraku.  Overall, I've found the food to be good, and the environment is nice for lunch.  Easy location in the Metreon as well.  However, in a couple cases, the service has been quite slow.  Also, in my last visit, we found them to be rude.  Specifically, we finished lunch and paid, at which point they asked us to free up the table.  We had only been there a total of 40 minutes, so it seems inappropriate to shove us out the door.

Convenient location and decent food - but the service could be better.
author: Brian O.

description:
3.5 stars calls it about right for Sanraku. While I'd consider this an above average restaurant for it's mall location, the value just isn't quite there. $33 for a 15-piece sashimi is steep, and while the fish is tasty, the cuts aren't generous. The service was slow to start on my last recent visit but picked up toward the end of the meal. 

I am pretty damn impressed by the quality of the sake list here. It's not extensive but much more complete than most sushi restaurants I encounter. They have one of my faves, Seikyo, 

I'll definitely come back, and with touched up service could see my experience jumping up to a 4-star level.
author: Don B.

description:
Solid sushi.  Convenient location next to the amazing Yerba Buena open area.  However, I prefer the ambience of the Union Sq branch -- somehow feels more.... intimate?

The Buta Kakuni is delicious! (melt in your mouth + good flavor)
author: Kathryn C.

description: Quality has gone downhill.  Sesame chicken overcooked, dry and slightly burned.  The sushi roll was certainly not generous in ingredients.  I'd expect this in a rural town, but not SF.
author: J C.

description:
Went here on a Sunday night around 6:30 after our movie ended. It wasn't too busy, which we found as a surprise since it was Mother's Day and it was prime dinner time. 

The first thing I noticed was the price. It's a bit on the pricy side to make this a "go-to" restaurant. But I guess that comes with the location of it being inside the Metreon. 

We ordered the sesame chicken & tempura dinner entree, a katsu-don with brown rice, and the San Francisco roll. The first thing I noticed was how fast the food came. I'm not a fan of waiting too long for food, especially when I'm starving (I admit, I have the case of the 'hangry'), so I was very happy at how fast our food came.

The food was tasty and flavorful, especially the sesame chicken. The dinner entree can be a bit big that my boyfriend even took half of his order home for lunch the next day. My katsu-don was enough. A lot of rice, but I can't complain because I love that they offer brown rice. 

Overall, I probably won't come back often. But I definitely recommend Sanraku if you're looking for a decent place to have dinner in the area that's not fast food or food court. 

A big thumbs up to the service. Our server was friendly, attentive and polite.
author: Liezel D.

description:
First time trying this place out. I really liked how their sushi roll was prepared. The rice was perfectly cooked and the proportions were plenty for me (glad to not over eat). 

The udon broth was well seasoned the the noodles were prepared correctly with a little chewy to it. Will definitely come back!
author: Tiffany L.

description: I honestly didn't know what to expect from a sushi restaurant in Metreon, which is mainly composed of food court-style food, but I was pleasantly surprised. If you're coming here anyway to watch a movie, your ticket stub will get you a free edamame appetizer. Other than that, I found the food to be reasonably priced. The classic rolls may only cost you ~$8, while the specialty rolls are closer to ~$13. My friends and I just shared a bunch of food, consisting of edamame, tonkatsu, gyoza, spicy tuna roll, poke roll, california roll, and roll n roll...uh roll. It wasn't busy in the restaurant on a Friday night (maybe we were early?), but I've seen it get super packed when there's a convention in Moscone Center nearby, just FYI.
author: Bianca C.

description:
My son and I tried this place because it was across the street from our hotel and my boy needed some sushi. Independent of some other so-so reviews, we were happy with it.  I had tempura udon which was tasty. And my son had a ton of salmon rolls.  He said it wasn't as epic as our favorite top notch sushi place in Berkeley, but that it was definitely way better than the storefront place that he gets it from after school.  So, basically what we would have expected. Which is good.  It was actually better than I was expecting. Also good. 

We were seated quickly even though it was a busy weekend evening and we did not have reservations.    Apparently they take reservations.  The service was very friendly and attentive.  I would definitely eat here again. Especially considering the fact that is basically in the food court at a mall.   Good stuff for a food court.
author: Heather J.

description:
This place has a sushi bar and strangely it has an omakase option. Given that the place is extremely busy during lunch time, omakase is not recommended.

I tried the cold noodle there, which was okay. The portion, including the tempura, was quite large. The food tasted okay. Service was decent.
author: Sydney C.

description:
I ate some of vegitable starters, sushi and sashimi platters, tamago. 
Taste is delicate and Japanese-style. It's good to enjoy the sophisticated taste of the ingredients.
author: Kayoko K.

description:
I have two words for you -- Sesame Chicken! This is my favorite sesame chicken of all time! I went over for lunch and made the mistake of not ordering it and ordering a roll instead. The roll was good, but luckily I had made some roll for chicken trade agreements with fellow lunch mates. The chicken was crispy! I can count on one hand the places I have gotten crispy sesame chicken and the count solely involves this place. The sauce was delicious and the perfect amount. I even went back here the next day to get the chicken. 

Next time I am in San Fran we will meet again!
author: Holly K.

description:
We had Mirugai (giant clam) sushi. It was very fresh and delicious. Just the right amount of chewiness. Sashimi salad was very good. Nice Rainbow roll. Fresh fish. 

Don't be put off by the food court, if you enter from the Metreon movie theater side, instead of the Yerba Buena park side. 

Decent sake selection. 

Didn't try them but there were many bento and a fair number of udon dishes on the menu.
author: Marcus J.

description: Honestly I was very impressed with this place. Considering it is located in the Metreon next to a bunch of other "mall foods", Sanraku had a relatively authentic feel. The food was delicious and the portions were very generous! I ordered the Chicken Don and the serving was very generous! It came with miso soup and salad which were both tasty. I knocked off a star for the poor food quality warning that shows up on the Yelp page but I thought this place was yummy!
author: Diana F.

description: My biggest pet peeve is paying for overpriced food. They don't use real crab meat, so it feels like eating textureless crab meat from the grocery store sushi. We ordered 3 rolls and my other friend who doesn't eat seafood ordered the tonkatsu. We paid $17.00 which isn't much for sushi, but for technically just one plate per person and the considering the quality of the sushi, I would not want to come back here for dinner. Maybe lunch will be better.
author: Tatiana T.

description:
This review is based off of my first and only time going there so it may not be completely reliable.  However, I went there for lunch and was seated right away even though the other person in my party was not there yet.  The restaurant has character and although it is small, the spaced is well used.  There is outside seating area that has a nice view and would be perfect on a nice day.

The service was okay, actually the bus boys were more on top of it then the waiters.  I ordered the tofu meal since I am vegetarian.  It comes with Miso soup, small salad and rice ($1 more for brown).  My tofu was so good and I loved the veggies.  I loved whatever they marinated tofu in, it was delicious.  I will definitely go back again.  I don't think it was too expensive and I felt like I got a lot of food.  Next time I may try something else but, it will be hard to resist the tofu again.
author: Megan M.

description: My favorite sashimi salad.. Usually good service and nice atmosphere. Family friendly and good food!!
author: Angiel S.

description:
Pricey, but *everything* we ordered was good. More like 3.5 stars, but the excellent service bumped it up to 4.

Portions for non-sushi items were great! 

Appetizers: 
+ Agedashi tofu
+ Pork belly (buta)

Nigiri:
+ All of it... Seriously. Check out the photo.
author: Christina H.

description: Went for a lunch today while I was in town for a conference. Food was fresh and tasty and the service was great. Had a combination lunch special and left feeling full and happy!
author: Christi M.

description:
There are plenty of reasons to like Sanraku:
- They accept reservations at the busy lunch hour
- I can sprint from my desk and be there in five minutes
- Outdoor seating when the weather permits
- There's something for everyone: sushi, bento, noodle soups

But a few weeks ago I finally found a reason to crave Sanraku: curry udon!

I went back yesterday and ordered it again: so satisfying. I love curry and I love udon but I was skeptical about the two together. Now I'm kicking myself for not having discovered this delicious combination sooner!
author: Miriam W.

description:
While I prefer the location on Sutter, this is a very reasonable sushi place at the Metreon and close to Moscone if you want to escape the food at the conference center.

I found all dishes reasonably good. Cooked food is a bit less authentic than sushi and sashimi platters.
author: Stefano Z.

description: Tasty sushi. Reasonably priced. Didn't realize it was in a mall though! Volcano roll and Tempura roll were both good.
author: Brittany N.

description:
I really like this place. The wait is pretty long on weekends, but so worth it. I recommended the amaebi (sweet shrimp), amberjack and Spanish mackerel nigiri. Can't comment on any of the rolls (but c'mon, we're all adults. Should we even be getting those anymore?) Definitely order the hot sake for a wonderful combination. The service is a bit slow, but that's too be expected when there are only so many sushi chefs on duty at a time. The wait only makes it better. 

It's located on Sutter kinda Union Square-ish. Very cute and cozy interior with, of course, a nice big street-facing window for excellent people watching.
author: Rachel M.

description:
This is a restaurant where you need to order the right stuff.  We had the following tonight
Soft shell crab tempura- 4/5
Toro lovers plate - 4/5
Sashimi deluxe - 3/5
Uni - 4.5/5
Unagi - 4.5/5

Based on food alone, I'll be more inclined to give the restaurant a 3.5 up to 4 stars.  However, the waitress we got was not too friendly and worse of all, she forgot to submit our ticket to the sushi chef.  So sat there for 45 minutes watching everyone else that came after us got their food but just not us.  And she was reluctant to apologize.  Therefore I deducted half a star.
author: BB G.

description:
This place is awkwardly located in the food court of the Metreon so it doesn't quite have the atmosphere of a normal restaurant. It's semi blocked off but you can still see and hear everyone in the food court so it's pretty loud. 

Service is quick - didn't have to wait very long for our food to come out or for our check at the end. It does seem pretty busy on weeknights though (at least on a Thursday at 6:30) so I'd recommend making a reservation if you don't want to wait 15-20 min.

Food is pretty good. Some things are pretty pricey though and I'm not sure if they'd be worth the price (like the sushi/sashimi platters and chirashi). I ordered the sashimi salad and shared the Golden Gate roll with my friend.

==========

-SASHIMI SALAD ($15) - 4/5
I originally wanted to get the sashimi platter ($30) because I really wanted sashimi and a friend recommended it, but I wasn't very hungry and didn't really want to spend $30 if I wasn't sure if I could eat it all. So I opted for the salad version instead to get my sashimi fix and was very satisfied! There's a good amount of sashimi for only $15! More worth it than the $12-14 rolls in my opinion and there's a decent variety (salmon, tuna, white tuna, shrimp, fish roe and one or two other fish I couldn't identify). The sashimi was pretty fresh and had a good texture. I've definitely had better, but it was good for the price.

-GOLDEN GATE ROLL ($12) - 3.5/5
Nothing particularly special about this roll. Imitation crab and avocado on the inside, salmon on the outside, topped with tobiko and scallions and with a miso sauce. The crab mix was a little creamy and the salmon was pretty fresh like the sashimi salad. Sauce was light. Overall, not very memorable but nothing bad about it.
author: Jessie L.

description: A solid spot for Japanese. We got a sushi samples full of everything from squid to shrimp to yellow tail. My dining companion order the tempura shrimp and I took it to be rather bland. But the service, quality of the sushi sampler were enough for me to want to return someday. I recommend this spot if you're pressed for time but still want a sit-down, light Japanese lunch. Sanraku met our needs as we were pressed for time and had a major sushi craving. It gets pretty busy during lunch time- but not too busy to get an immediate seat for 2 during peak hours.
author: Helina G.

description: Sushi is small and expensive but good. I would've rather gotten the dinner combination. It would get you full than ordering two rolls.
author: Eileen Joy P.

description: This place is pretty good.  Nothing extraordinary but quality sushi you can get at above average prices.  Not my first choice but would eat there if it was the convenient option in the area.
author: Jay H.

description:
got to try the sashimi salad that seems to be rather popular. I want to give this place a 3.5 but overall it was good but for $15, it wasn't worth it I think. You get a variety of fishes such as salmon, tuna, and white tuna and some roe. The salad is green mix and then a few tomatoes as well so it wasn't anything super fancy. I could have gotten a whole chirashi sample and a lot more for that price at another location. Fish was fresh though and didn't taste slimey or anything. 

Service was good though. The lady that helped me was very nice.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: I've been here for lunch a couple times and I feel like it's pretty reliable. I've never been disappointed with anything and it's a bit better than your average Japanese food. I'm kinda obsessed with bento boxes and theirs is damn good. Last time I had a noodle bowl that was good by nothing worth getting again over the bento box. The real shining star here is the gyoza appetizer. Everyone seems to love it and it's a must to start your meal.
author: Scotty C.

description: Some flaws, mostly with service.  Food was very good, however. Tonkatsu dinner 7.5/10 (salad was poor, badly wilted, and mixed veg was fair. Katsu was very good), seafood Chawanmushi 9/10, one of the best I've had in years.
author: Brent S.

description:
Came here after cross country flight, staying nearby at the Marriott. My five year old was cranky and hungry. The staff were super sweet to him, bringing his food first. 
My wife and I had sushi and it was fresh and delicious and excellently prepared. Started with the pork belly. Yum. My son had salmon teriyaki and it was so much he couldn't finish.
author: David S.

description:
As a Japanese raised in Japan, I think this is one of the best places to have good Nigiri sushis.
I take my clients here when they want to have good food.
author: Made In J.

description:
It's not exactly a 3 star, but not quite up to a 4-star rating. I would say Sanraku is a solid 3.75. Don't get me wrong, this place was great, and it has been my go-to for sushi in downtown SF for the past month and a half. I just can't seem to find enough reason to bump it up to 4 stars.

The place is located in the food court of the metreon, but the restaurant itself is nicely decorated, and it doesn't feel like eating in a food court at all. The place is small (like most restaurants in SF), and does get packed around dinner time, so I would probably recommend making a reservation in advance...

I have tried all the specialty rolls that doesn't have eel, the eskimo roll, SF roll, spicy roll, and the katsu-don rice bowl. All the ingredients tasted fresh, and the portions do not disappoint. It definitely hits the spot when you are craving sushi. 

The katsu don bowl didn't really do it for me. It's fried pork that is coated with eggs, so it's a bit crispy and soggy at the same time. The flavors were great, and they don't skimp out on the meat and rice. For me, it really was the weird crispy/soggy texture that turned me away from this dish.

Overall, it's a great place to visit when you are craving sushi! The staff are all very friendly and attentive. I love that it's in such a convenient location!
author: Sherry C.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by Sanraku--I must admit that I did not have the highest expectations for a chain sushi restaurant inside of the Metreon food court. The sashimi was delicious and the servers were friendly and attentive. Servers brought out our food quickly and provided refills of hot tea and water without being asked. We really enjoyed the Chirashi Sushi and the Sashimi Deluxe. Portions were generous and the fish was very fresh. The food was a bit pricey given the location. Our bill came to about ~$100+ for only these three items  

The ambiance was casual but the mood lighting and modern decor provided a trendy feel. Sanraku is located in the food court but it is walled off so that you feel as if you are in a separate sit down restaurant. I wouldn't recommend it for a date night because you'll feel the hustle and bustle of the servers scurrying around (more so if you are seated at a table instead of the sushi bar) and you'll also be privy to your neighbor's conversations. It was crowded for dinner on a Saturday night so try to call ahead or make a reservation if possible. They have a discounts rewards card that you can sign up for at the end of your meal.
author: Kristin C.

description: If you're looking for sushi... go somewhere else. I ordered off of the chef's menu and ordered two rolls. Typically this would be enough for a meal. After the meal came out and the chef handed it to me, I asked "which roll is this?" He said it was both rolls I ordered. It ended up being 4 pieces. FOUR. For $27. Ridiculous. I frequently come to downtown San Francisco for work and am a HUGE sushi fan, but this is a pathetic excuse. Go somewhere else!
author: Sage G.

description: Don't eat here! When the sushi came out, we thought the rainbow roll didn't look very fresh but thought we would try it anyway. About 3 pieces in, my girlfriend ate a piece that she described as fishy. She she it tasted off. We told the waiter and he asked us if we wanted to get another one. We opted to get another rock and roll because that one seemed to be okay. The rolls are overpriced for what you get and definitely not fresh. I pulled up yelp to see how they rated AFTER we sent the roll back. Found out they have a horrible score and will NOT be eating here again. I forgot to mention the fruit flies that were flying around our table even before any food was brought out. Its been about 10 minutes since we finished eating and my stomach already hurts.
author: Debbie C.

description: I have eaten here many times but have yet to rate until now and for a Japanese fix, we come here because this seems to be the only place in the Downtown area where it is convenient, near BART.  This restaurant is located in the newly remodeled Metreon, which now has an expanded food court besides this restaurant inside the mall.  When we came, it was bustling with office workers and people attending a convention.  We ordered the chicken teriyaki, salmon teriyaki and Bento Box special of the day!  The daily bento box special is totally worth it for the price and it was fried oysters, with gyoza, California roll, fruit, salad and soup!  All were good except that I made the mistake of ordering chicken teriyaki which was grilled and alittle dry.
author: Karen W.

description:
Located on the first floor of the former Sony Metreon (I think it's called Target City now) you can find Sanraku located on the side of the Yerba Buena Gardens.  It's the only separate restaurant that is on the edge of the food court also located on the same floor.  You don't expect to find a super authentic Japanese restaurant in the middle of this mall, but it comes close.  You can get fresh sashimi, sushi, bentos, udon, etc. served here.

We had Unagi-Don (not a whole lot of unagi, and sort of on the dry side), sushi lunch (Cali Roll, and several pieces of Nigiri), Hamachi Sashimi (fresh), edamame, and Agedashi Tofu (good).  Overall, the food was pretty good, and came with miso soup and salad.  A little pricier than what you would normally pay since it is in a primo and convenient location.  Service was friendly and attentive.  Definitely recommend if you are in the mood for Japanese in the area.  We found it especially convenient since we were headed to the AMC theaters on Level 3 after lunch!
author: Lawrence L.

description: The sushi was amazing, the tonkatsu was really crisp on the outside and juicy in the inside.
author: Sidharta K.

description:
I've eaten sushi lunch at Sanraku twice now. It's right across the street from our offices and so it makes it an easy choice. Plus, they have some pretty decent lunch specials and a patio if you happen to catch SF on one of their rare warm and sunny days.

The sushi is fairly average, but it comes fast and is affordable. The lunch specials are a great deal, too and the food servings are giant. I've had pretty standard stuff here, sesame chicken, spicy tuna rolls, and so on, but I've eaten with vegetarians and sashimi lovers who have all been able to find something they enjoy.

Pro tip: Order your lunch as soon as you are greeted if possible. Otherwise it can take a bit of time for them to get back to you.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Came in on a Sunday evening and sat at the sushi bar. I thought it was a nice touch that they give you a pre-wrapped wet wipe for your hands. They seem to be very conscious of the fact that we are walking around the mall, with not so clean hands 
Anyways onto the food: 
1 volcano roll
1 49's roll
1 miso soup
Everything was good, nothing was a disappointment. I'll be back whenever I'm in the area, but I won't make a special trip here.
author: Ericka M.

description:
I got lunch with my husband and infant son at Sanraku. 
The food was great. We shared the Sushi Lover's lunch and the Chicken Udon soup. Both were delicious, especially the sushi.

The staff was very accommodating and moved chairs out of the way so that we could fit the stroller next to the table. Even though they were busy and we occupied a table for 4, we didn't feel rushed at all.

The place looks very clean and they have a health score of 100. 
Will go there again.
author: Katarina K.

description:
One of my favorite lunch options - tasty, relatively healthy with outdoor seating. It's one of the few places in the area that has great outdoor seating.

I often get the daily bento box which will have two different "mains" (salmon/chicken teriyaki, gyoza, chicken karaage), California roll, miso soup and salad. It's $12 which isn't a deal but not bad for the quality (and variety) of food. If the daily bento box is not to my liking, I often get the salmon teriyaki. 

Service is generally fast and efficient though avoid this place (and the entire area) if there's a big conference at Moscone.
author: Wendy L.

description:
The sushi was decent, but the reason I'm writing this review is because of the service. Absolutely 5 stars all the way, in that regard. My wife and I were trying to find a specific sake we've had before (not here), and our waitress was so patient with us and gave us tasters of 4 different kinds. She definitely went above and beyond to help us find something we'd like, and was so kind in the process.

As for the sushi itself, my baseline is always yellowtail - that's the one thing I get so I can compare sushi places. The yellowtail here was mostly good, though a little firm in some areas. I probably wouldn't get it again, though.

The location is sort of funny - back side of a food court. If you're trying to find this place, don't come in from the street, because you won't find it there!
author: Cory W.

description:
